intro: Seseli bocconei subsp. praecox, commonly known as early seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or mountainous regions. It is native to the Mediterranean Basin and parts of southern Europe. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in open, sunny areas with well-drained soil.
